meanings.definition: Treat (a person, group, or concept) as insignificant or peripheral.
meanings.sent1: Some people try to marginalize others by not including them in activities.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to marginalize someone just because they are different.
meanings.sent3: At the party, they tried to marginalize the new student, but he ended up having the most fun.
meanings.sent4: Her loud voice tends to marginalize the opinions of others in the group.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's constant praise helped to marginalize the shy student's fears of speaking up.

meanings.sent1: Bullying can marginalize a person and make them feel alone.
meanings.sent2: She didn't mean to marginalize her friend by forgetting to invite her to the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to play with the dog seemed to marginalize him in the pet community.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to marginalize the sun, casting a shadow over the whole town.
meanings.sent5: The boss's constant criticism started to marginalize the employee, making him doubt his abilities.

meanings.definition: Exclude or ignore (someone) from a group or society.
meanings.sent1: It is hurtful to marginalize others by leaving them out of important discussions.
meanings.sent2: She felt marginalized when her classmates purposely ignored her during lunch.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to marginalize the birds by stealing all the birdseed.
meanings.sent4: The loud music at the party seemed to marginalize those who preferred quiet conversations.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules of the club started to marginalize members who couldn't attend every meeting.
